meanings.definition: To make a bid higher than (an opponent's bid) in a card game.
meanings.sent1: During the game, I decided to overcall my opponent's bid.
meanings.sent2: Players often overcall when they believe they have a strong hand.
meanings.sent3: The player's overcall surprised everyone and led to an unexpected win.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to overcall was like a bold move in a game of chess.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her overcall echoed through the room, signaling her confidence.

meanings.definition: A bid higher than (an opponent's bid) in a card game.
meanings.sent1: His overcall changed the course of the game.
meanings.sent2: The winning strategy involved a well-timed overcall.
meanings.sent3: The overcall made by the rookie player drew admiration from the veterans.
meanings.sent4: The overcall was like a trump card played at the perfect moment.
meanings.sent5: The overcall stood out as a brilliant move in the match.
